intro: Mesembryanthemum stellans, commonly known as the star ice plant, is a succulent flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in winter, producing bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid environments.
